column5: Thanks Irish that fixed it.
I have a bunch but I love this one from last summer dad and my daughter the day dad got his first muskie I think Roy liked this one also or atleast the sponser
Here`s my favourite from last summer....  Early morning at lake X    And one of the Dog at the same spot     Doug
this is my fav - 50" x 30" Lake Trout caught in under 10' of water in Great Bear Lake, July 9th , 2006 at 10:05 am

Wow..Lots of great pictures. Way to go gang.  These are not particularly photogenic shots but ones that I'm proud of my son Nick and also my apprentice Ash who built cars for our local fall fair demolition derby. They both built great cars. Ash was second overall and was a big crowd pleaser. Unfortunately Nick lost battery connection and was eliminated early. These derbys are a lot of work to prepare for but a riot to do.
Favorite Pic's
I always liked this spider pic I took on Green Island, off the Taiwan coast.  This was right on the side of the road and I had to duck on the far side of the web to get the shot.

hey deplumma , great pic ...i can spot that dock and boat out no prob....you were at the casablanca lodge on the upper french....what a beautiful area....to bad the fishing isnt what it use to be ....had quite a few beers on that dock this summer .....cheers

First Tracks on a back lake for splake......    My son, my father and I went crappie fishing last spring.......Jacob got the biggest one........still reminds  me to this day.....we'll never forget it.    Me just kicking back for a bit of a snooze on the walleye opener........just finished a killer shore lunch of fresh eyes and perch......MMMMM.    Just got the gear in the boat this morning as the sun was breaking the hills........what a beautiful sight......could have just sat there and watched it. I went fishing instead    Here's what I caught......  Notice the change in weather from first light......it rained the rest of the day.....bout 30 mins after the sunrise pic!     Great pics, keep them  coming!!  Sinker
Amazing.  Can't add much more great thread. All of the pics are great.

here is a picture of my son and his very first fish, we took a small hike through our backyard and right to the water reservoir, where i casted his spinner bait and let him have it from there on in...  Bud
This is my favorite  Matt
That's a beautiful picture Matt, and  it won't be much longer now !!
Few People can paint life. Few can write about life in poatry but to capture life as it happens is true Art. Thank you for the amazzing shots. Peace

My "photo to remember" isn't fishing related but I just love it!   She will kill me for doing this but the before & after scenario helps with the appreciation  This is my oldest in an earlier post by Cliff......     Here she is at her Grade 8 grad  with her entourage.....     She is an awesome kid and this picture always makes me smile.....most of her teachers and some of her classmates didn't recognize her that night  bly
Every year for the May run....beauty spot, awesome fishing....  Brkygetr
Two of my favourite pics.  There is a wicked little bay with some huge pike just through those narrows. Manitouwabing Lake north of Parry Sound.
talk about wearing diapers, I would most definitely be wearing one to work that high off the ground.
TRAIL TO THE LAKE   WAITIN FOR THE FISH TO SHOW
rickster....great pics....seeing the smiling faces of your own kids is priceless.  When I fish with them, I could care less if I caught anything!
Ok..was i the only one who got the willies looking at that pic up high??? jeez!!!
Ya really gotta believe in fall restraints!! Wonder what they pay these guys?
These are some nice pictures!
These are all great pictures to bad i dont have the net at home then atleast i would be able to share some of mine with all of you. Have a great weekend everyone happy fishing

Great post and amazing pictures. Made me finally try to figure out how to post pics. Hope it works. I posted 4....noob gets carried away.  Favorite back lake on Opening Bass morning. This bay is full of boulders the size of trucks, you can see them poking out thru the fog. Buckets hiding behind most of them  same lake opening morning.  a "tupperwear boat" Largie  Restoule Lake   Hookset.
Great shots hookset.  To make them show up here...go back in your post...hit edit..quick edit and then add [ img ] in front of each one and [ /img ] behind each one...but no spaces!!
I know its an ice/winter pic but I like it. Took it couple of winters ago around the corner from my place in the A.M.
You sound like you are "sorry"  for posting it. You should be proud of it It is beautifull
Not at all Keram...Just thought most would like to see summer related stuff. Thank you.I do like the way it turned out.
well here are the most important things to me.. This is my missus and I....My son he is gona be 7 may 30... and my dog (or little furry hyper creature)
Ancious moment before blast off~!   OMG~ Pirate Ship in Rice Lake~

This is one of my favourite pictures was from this past summer. I took my family to Canadas' Wonderland in Toronto and my oldest daugter who is 11 said she would not go on a rollercoaster and I kept beggin her to go on them with me and she finally caved to this one! You could see I was pretty happy to have a partner for the coasters as well. LOL!!!A couple favs of my youngest as well LOL!Last picture she is staring at a chocolate fountain at a wedding we went to this past summer as well.
Lake Ontario fishing off the pier in east end
I always liked this shot.
Wicked shot Dan..you have an eye for that photo stuff Joe

Wow!  There are so many candid shots capturing such quick and monumental frames of what each of us individually consider to be meaningful.  It's difficult to narrow it down!  Here are two shots, both taken last summer at my boyfriends cottage, in the back bay behind and at one of our favourite fishing spots, aptely named " Sunset Bay"  The time we've spent there has definitely been the most memorable and special time of my life to date!!

This was last August one early morning along the Trent river nearby Hastings   And this one makes me laugh my son in the orange shirt and his cousin august long weekend at my bro-in-laws cottage  The power of a feather in the eye of the beholder lol.
Rendering an antitank mine safe by seperating the fuses
The very last time I remember having one of my children fall asleep in my arms in the middle of the day!
Hard to pick just one.So here is three. One  with each of my favorite girls.           And one of my favorite sienery shots.
All great pics. Thanks  everyone for posting them.

Opening night for Rainbows, looking forward to the day once agian this year. Only another 40 some odd days to go!    My daughter with her WGSF! She also caught her first muskie that weekend! Proud to say her muskie photo made the Essox Angler Mag with an article Snady wrote. She is quite the fisher gal, my daughter that is, not Snady, well you know what I mean!
Ron that is an AWESOME photo bud.Remember the first time you posted that one.

I've posted this one before but I always liked the way it turned out considering it was just a fluke.  I was running down the lake wide open early in the morning doing about 75 KPH and as the sun popped up over the horizon, I just held the camera up over my shoulder and clicked the shutter without even turning around.  Luv the way the water sparkles off the water droplets.
Some great shots all around....   Ducks and a Five Mile Lake Sunset   Fishing the Gamble River between Wasp & Crow's Rock Lakes in NW Ontario
A few here that I like.....  The French in October    Close to where I was born..    My Daughters Wedding     John...
Hi Guys,  I've been a long time reader, but this topic got me to register and start posting.  Here's a picture of the greatest moment of my life...
Hi Ishmael, (I assume that it's OK to call you that)...   Welcome aboard....That is indeed a beauty!!
This was on the way to blast-off at a Everstart event on Vermillion Lake in Minnesota!

Took these pics last year on May 31st. It was 39 Celcius that day! Warm weather is not far away.  My 3 yr. old in awe of a chub.  After fishing fairly hardcore for 25 yrs. i was in awe of this little rainbow darter coughed up by 13 in. brookie i had caught. First time seeing one! Out of a Durham trib.   ehg

I was hoping that everyone would post a pic that they have doing something!!! C'mon people share a moment!!! lol    Me in the mountains!!! this is a pic from when I was living in Calgary and went out to B.C. to the mountains to hit the slopes
This could be an interesting topic.Prolly my favorite picture I have taken up north.Brings back some memories.  Joe
That is an absolutely gorgeous boat, is it yours.
No,it belonged to the lodge that we stayed at back in 2001.I love the looks of a cedar strip. Joe
That is a damn good pic Joe!

I don't take a lot of pictures but this is one of my favorites. Three generations enjoying a beautiful day on the water. I am finally in a position where I can afford to make these kind of days happen and I plan on their being a lot more of these to come.
Well two actually:   and we can't forget:
Clampet?!?! whats all that about???? you breaking the law?? Did tarpus maximus get you a ticket maximus?
I took this picture in 2005 while fishing at Jordan Lake,525 miles north of Winnipeg  Regards, Snowball
Er... well that is Not Tarpus Maximus.  That was Not Quite a Kite. And the gentleman isn't me either, I'm not that big.
lol sorry just was curious to what those pics were all 'bout?!?

Your a the top of the world in that one Bookoo, nice pic. Just got a digi cam in the fall, never had a camera before, seen this rattler and a few bears swimming 3 days in a row in October swimming to Islands, but didn't get any good shots of a bear, also one bear was in a cottage on an Island, my dad and the contractor that takes care of the cottage had to go kill it, it wouldn't leave the house, and he tore everything up, looked like a keg party the day after.

Of course you let that baby go John ! No point risking the feds comin after you trying to fine you the $250K that they threaten these days out on Beausoli Island PPark for killing a Massasauga. I remember the owner in 3 lakes campground in Parry Sound trying to tell me my youngest almost picked up a Hognose snake, when I asked him to move it off our site. Told him if that's all it was to pick it up himself and move it...he refused! I find them just about every year here in the yard. Never pick a board up in the sun without using a stick/shovel.  Now if we'd all re-read his original post....picture of YOU doing something...

That's a really good pic Bookoobeast.  I'm kind of partial to this one.  That's me sitting there while ice fishing on Simcoe one year.  I think DouG took it when I was unaware.  It's seems so peaceful.     Joey
Is that a BLUE???? nice fish!!!

Introducing my youngest (age 4 at the time) to fishing....Here's he first fish ever!!  The smile and excitement was priceless...she wants to fish any opportunity she gets...we've had to bribe her off off docks after nine hours of fishing last summer!!    My 14 year old getting in to the action as well.    My wife, bly on a peaceful summer night....   My dad...who introduced me to fishing...our last trip before he passed away just 7 months later.   And....my only daytime Walleye picture!
Resting after a portage. Algonquin. Good Times
the start of the 2005 Red Lake Walleye classic was a little foggy
I will add my whitewater pics Kayak and rafting etc once I find the dvd they are on...   Gerritt.
Holy smokes Gerritt, your wife must have had some good calcium intake while preggers, look at the length of the fingernails.  Neato.  Great pics.  Joey
A couple from last July at Lake Holinshead, these were taken on a magical evening after 10:00pm while fishing for walleye with my son.    Whopper
I like this one very much. Lake Scugog 9 of July 2004 6:00 am Cloud on the water

Maybe not my best photos, but appropriate for today and the time of day. I took the shot.  That's not me leaning into the window of #20.     Here's a closer shot.  Smoke scatters the crowd when he leaves the garage area and when he returns from the track.  This was taken October 26, 2002, either the last race or last year garage passes were available to racing fans.  It was an exciting morning for me.
